chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth J Brown was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --To pay fine of $1000+ costs= $2323 plus attorney fees.  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 46 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--To serve 9 months jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive, to commence FORTHWITH. 

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process. 

--DNA sample provision
Consecutive to:

--AODA assessment and follow through

--Attendance at a Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 33 month period

--Revocation of drivers license for 33 months

--6 demerit points assessed

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 10:52am 
Defendant Kenneth J Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Kenneth J Brown.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Brown waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " is entered on Count #1; factual basis is stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3

The Court rejects probation; gives basis

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve  9 months   jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive, to commence FORTHWITH. 
--Days credit for time already served: 65 days

--To pay fine of $1000+ costs= $2323 plus attorney fees.  The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 46 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 33 months
--AODA assessment and follow through
--Attendance at a Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 33 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
recess: 11:14am
Waiver of Prelim on November 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 2:13pm.  
Defendant Kenneth J Brown appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Karl Huebner (Attorney Huebner will look into Public Defender eligibility of Mr. Brown). 
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments are given by counsel regarding the State's request for cash bail. 

The Court requires a $1,500 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. 
recess 2:26pm. 

NEXT: Prelim Waiver on November 1st at 10:45am
Extradition Forecast

[ma] Case called at 8:46am 
Defendant Kenneth J Brown not in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Kenneth J Brown.  Hailey Shelton and DA Monica Hall appear under the student practice rule for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Huebner indicates that Mr. Brown has not answered phone calls/text messages today; has had communication since pretrial conference. 

Ms. Shelton requests warrant and bond be found in default. 

The Court authorizes warrant and finds bond in default. 
recess: 8:48am
Interim Statement of service Hours in the amount of 1.2 hours submitted by contract Attorney Karl E Huebner.
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:33am 
Defendant Kenneth J Brown in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel agree that the scheduling of a pretrial conference and then a preliminary hearing is appropriate.  Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is seeking a plea offer. 
recess 8:36am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on July 27th at 10:00am--only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on August 9th at 8:30am

Defendant Kenneth J Brown in court.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

recess: 8:52am 
NEXT: Status on 7/11/22 at 8:30am (status of counsel)
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

Conditions of this Bond include:
-  Maintain absolute sobriety.
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:48PM
Defendant Kenneth J Brown appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Att De La Rosa advises the Court that he has provided the Defendant with a Petition for a County Appointed Attorney.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing timelimits and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel in Branch III.

The Court requires a $1,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
-  Maintain absolute sobriety.
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:55PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/16 at 9:00AM
